body_html:
Hi @kirk86 , which commit of pytorch0.4 are you on?
Also could you try this simple script?

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

batch_size = 4

class Encoder(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv1d(in_channels=1, out_channels=5, kernel_size=3, padding=1)
        self.pool = nn.AvgPool1d(2)

    def forward(self, x):
        return self.pool(self.conv(x))

model = nn.DataParallel(Encoder()).cuda()

import pdb
pdb.set_trace()
x = torch.rand([batch_size, 1, 20]).cuda()
z = model(x)
loss = nn.L1Loss()

l = loss(z, torch.rand(z.shape).cuda())

l.backward()

If this doesn't work, please try rebuild your pytorch with master branch. If this passes, could you send us a complete minimal repro script?

body:
Hi @kirk86 , which commit of pytorch0.4 are you on? 
Also could you try this simple script?
```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

batch_size = 4

class Encoder(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.conv = nn.Conv1d(in_channels=1, out_channels=5, kernel_size=3, padding=1)
        self.pool = nn.AvgPool1d(2)

    def forward(self, x):
        return self.pool(self.conv(x))

model = nn.DataParallel(Encoder()).cuda()

import pdb
pdb.set_trace()
x = torch.rand([batch_size, 1, 20]).cuda()
z = model(x)
loss = nn.L1Loss()

l = loss(z, torch.rand(z.shape).cuda())

l.backward()
```
If this doesn't work, please try rebuild your pytorch with master branch. If this passes, could you send us a complete minimal repro script?
